abstract: The cube texture data to use as a color lookup table.
overview:
## Discussion

This filter maps color values in the input image to new color values using a three-dimensional color lookup table. For each RGBA pixel in the input image, the filter uses the R, G, and B component values as indices to identify a location in the table; the RGBA value at that location becomes the RGBA value of the output pixel.

Use the [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIColorCube/cubeData] parameter to provide data formatted for use as a color lookup table, and the inputCubeDimension parameter to specify the size of the table. This data should be an array of texel values in 32-bit floating-point RGBA linear premultiplied format. The inputCubeDimension parameter identifies the size of the cube by specifying the length of one side, so the size of the array should be [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIColorCube/cubeDimension] cubed times the size of a single texel value. In the color table, the R component varies fastest, followed by G, then B.

# cube0Data

**Instance Property**

The cube texture data to use as a color lookup table.

## Declaration

```swift
var cube0Data: Data { get set }
```

## Discussion

This filter maps color values in the input image to new color values using a three-dimensional color lookup table. For each RGBA pixel in the input image, the filter uses the R, G, and B component values as indices to identify a location in the table; the RGBA value at that location becomes the RGBA value of the output pixel.

Use the [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIColorCube/cubeData] parameter to provide data formatted for use as a color lookup table, and the inputCubeDimension parameter to specify the size of the table. This data should be an array of texel values in 32-bit floating-point RGBA linear premultiplied format. The inputCubeDimension parameter identifies the size of the cube by specifying the length of one side, so the size of the array should be [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIColorCube/cubeDimension] cubed times the size of a single texel value. In the color table, the R component varies fastest, followed by G, then B.

## Instance Properties

- **colorSpace**: The working color space.
- **cube1Data**: The cube texture data to use as a color lookup table.
- **cubeDimension**: The length, in texels, of each side of the cube texture.
- **inputImage**: The image to use as an input image.
- **maskImage**: A masking image.
- **extrapolate**: If true, then the filter extrapolates the color cube for any RGB component values outside the range 0.0 to 1.0.
